pr_title: [Part 2] Add geo support  - add a geo aggregate function st_union

timeline.author: Jackie-Jiang
Jackie-Jiang
Jackie-Jiang

replies.bodyText: Can you explain the handling here, throw exception or something? My understanding is that the caller shall do the null handling?
replies.author: yupeng9

replies.bodyText: If there is no record selected, then aggregationResultHolder.getResult(); will return null because there is no value set yet. In that case, you should return an empty geometry as the result of the current segment
replies.author: Jackie-Jiang

replies.bodyText:
My question is why not use null as the placeholder instead of an empty abstract geometry? For example, in line #86 I checked if the group by result is null.
Perhaps I miss something in the general null handling strategy in agg functions.
replies.author: yupeng9

replies.bodyText: It won't work because DataTable does not support null as input (for sending back response from server to broker)
replies.author: Jackie-Jiang

replies.bodyText: ah, I see. So all aggregation result and group by result cannot use null as holders.
replies.author: yupeng9

replies.bodyText: The holder might contain null, but before returning the segment result, we need to convert null to the default value
replies.author: Jackie-Jiang

replies.bodyText: yup. Makes sense to me now
replies.author: yupeng9

timeline.bodyText: Need to handle null here (return an empty Geometry)
timeline.author: Jackie-Jiang

replies.bodyText: same question. There is no empty geometry, but emty geometry per specific type, e.g. GEOMETRYCOLLECTION EMPTY, POINT EMPTY, LINESTRING EMPTY
replies.author: yupeng9

replies.bodyText: We need to choose a default geometry to return when no record is selected. I think we can use empty Point as the default
replies.author: Jackie-Jiang

replies.bodyText: can you show me a query that will exhibit this no-record case?
replies.author: yupeng9

timeline.author: Jackie-Jiang

replies.bodyText:
This is not the same comparison logic as the final result, so we should put false here.
This is for ordering the union geometry for group-by queries, which will use the final result ByteArray order. It does not make a lot of sense to order them though
replies.author: Jackie-Jiang

replies.bodyText: I see. So the assumption is that the intermediate result comparable order must be the same as the final result.
replies.author: yupeng9

replies.bodyText: Yes, because they are for the same purpose
replies.author: Jackie-Jiang
